verses.verse: To the chief Musician<WH5329> upon<WH413> Shoshannim-eduth,<WH7802> A Psalm<WH4210> of Asaph.<WH623> Give ear,<WH238> O Shepherd<WH7462> of Israel,<WH3478> thou that leadest<WH5090> Joseph<WH3130> like a flock;<WH6629> thou that dwellest<WH3427> between the cherubims,<WH3742> shine forth.<WH3313>
Before <WH6440> Ephraim<WH669> and Benjamin<WH1144> and Manasseh<WH4519> stir up<WH5782> <WH853> thy strength,<WH1369> and come<WH1980> and save<WH3444> us.
Turn us again,<WH7725> O God,<WH430> and cause thy face<WH6440> to shine;<WH215> and we shall be saved.<WH3467>
O LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of hosts,<WH6635> how long<WH5704> <WH4970> wilt thou be angry<WH6225> against the prayer<WH8605> of thy people?<WH5971>
Thou feedest<WH398> them with the bread<WH3899> of tears;<WH1832> and givest them tears<WH1832> to drink<WH8248> in great measure.<WH7991>
Thou makest<WH7760> us a strife<WH4066> unto our neighbors:<WH7934> and our enemies<WH341> laugh<WH3932> among themselves.
Turn us again,<WH7725> O God<WH430> of hosts,<WH6635> and cause thy face<WH6440> to shine;<WH215> and we shall be saved.<WH3467>
Thou hast brought<WH5265> a vine<WH1612> out of Egypt:<WH4480> <WH4714> thou hast cast out<WH1644> the heathen,<WH1471> and planted<WH5193> it.
Thou preparedst<WH6437> room before<WH6440> it, and didst cause it to take deep root,<WH8327> <WH8328> and it filled<WH4390> the land.<WH776>
The hills<WH2022> were covered<WH3680> with the shadow<WH6738> of it, and the boughs<WH6057> thereof were like the goodly<WH410> cedars.<WH730>
She sent out<WH7971> her boughs<WH7105> unto<WH5704> the sea,<WH3220> and her branches<WH3127> unto<WH413> the river.<WH5104>
Why <WH4100> hast thou then broken down<WH6555> her hedges,<WH1447> so that all<WH3605> they which pass by<WH5674> the way<WH1870> do pluck<WH717> her?
The boar<WH2386> out of the wood<WH4480> <WH3293> doth waste<WH3765> it, and the wild beast<WH2123> of the field<WH7704> doth devour<WH7462> it.
Return, <WH7725> we beseech<WH4994> thee, O God<WH430> of hosts:<WH6635> look down<WH5027> from heaven,<WH4480> <WH8064> and behold,<WH7200> and visit<WH6485> this<WH2063> vine;<WH1612>
And the vineyard<WH3657> which<WH834> thy right hand<WH3225> hath planted,<WH5193> and the branch<WH1121> that thou madest strong<WH553> for thyself.
It is burned<WH8313> with fire,<WH784> it is cut down:<WH3683> they perish<WH6> at the rebuke<WH4480> <WH1606> of thy countenance.<WH6440>
Let thy hand<WH3027> be<WH1961> upon<WH5921> the man<WH376> of thy right hand,<WH3225> upon<WH5921> the son<WH1121> of man<WH120> whom thou madest strong<WH553> for thyself.
So will not<WH3808> we go back<WH5472> from<WH4480> thee: quicken<WH2421> us, and we will call<WH7121> upon thy name.<WH8034>
Turn us again,<WH7725> O LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of hosts,<WH6635> cause thy face<WH6440> to shine;<WH215> and we shall be saved.<WH3467>
